entries.entry: Kristen helped me fix some syntax issues so that user input would get posted to the DB.
Kristen helped me fix some syntax issues so that user input would get posted to the DB.

entries.concepts: I got the filtered data display working!
entries.entry: This morning right after I woke up I was able to quickly fix what I was having so much trouble with yesterday. First I had to fix my import syntax to match my exports. Then I had to import the container element that holds the JSON data on the DOM correctly (not as one feature but in a list in {}. Then, in the click event for each mood-filtering button, before I ran the method that display the JSON data to the DOM I reset my container element to an empty string, so that each time a btn is clicked the container would empty itself and then display the corresponding data.
Just learned that if I start json-server before starting the http-server I will get errors on page load. Need to start http-server first always!
